titles: The sence of the House or the opinion of some Lords and Commons, concerning the Londoners petition for peace.
publisher: Printed, by Leonard Lichfield; printer to the Vniversity,
notes: A Royalist satire, giving pretended reasons of various Lords and M.P.s for rejecting the idea of peace (Madan).
"This appears to be a London counterfeit, though in the absence of ornaments it is difficult to be sure."--Madan.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Humor --  Early works to 1800.
Political satire, English --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
